186020321.review:
[h1] RETRO BAKIŞ AÇISI [/h1]

[h2] Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic – Bir Retro Efsanesi [/h2]

Yıl 2003. Oyun dünyası, RPG türünün altın çağını yaşadığı, ama Star Wars oyunlarının genelde ya vasat ya da “eh işte” dedirttiği bir dönemdeydi. Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic (kısaca KOTOR) tam da bu ortamda geldi ve deyim yerindeyse galaksiye bomba gibi düştü. BioWare’in bu ustalık eseri, Star Wars evrenini sadece bir aksiyon sahnesinden ibaret sananlara tokat gibi bir ders verdi: Bu evren, anlatılacak hikayeler ve işlenebilecek karakterlerle dolup taşıyordu.

Bugün, zamanda geriye dönüp bu klasiği yeniden ele alıyoruz. Ama sadece bir “Star Wars oyunu” olarak değil, video oyunları tarihine geçmiş bir eser olarak.

[h2] Uzak Bir Galakside Farklı Bir Hikâye [/h2]

KOTOR, sinema ekranlarında gördüğümüz Skywalker ailesinin destanından çok, çok önce, yani Star Wars tarihinin binlerce yıl öncesinde geçiyor. Galaksi, Jedi ve Sith arasındaki savaşlarla parçalanmış bir halde. Oyunun başlangıcında, bir Cumhuriyet askerini kontrol ediyoruz; ama tabii ki BioWare, ilk 30 dakikada "bu karakter aslında sıradan biri değil" diyerek hikâyenin fitilini ateşliyor. Ve işte burada, klasik RPG formülü devreye giriyor: Kim olduğunuzu, geçmişinizi ve kaderinizi siz belirliyorsunuz.

Hikaye, Sith Lordu Darth Malak’ın galaksiyi ele geçirme planlarını, gizemli bir “Star Forge” yapısını ve Güç’ün doğasını sorgulayan devasa bir anlatıyı içinde barındırıyor. Ama KOTOR’un asıl gücü, sadece büyük olay örgüsünde değil; küçük, kişisel anlarda yatıyor. Oyun, karakterlerin ve seçimlerimizin hikayeyi nasıl şekillendirdiğini çok ustaca işliyor.

[h2] RPG’nin Gücü Adına! [/h2]

Bir RPG oyununda olmazsa olmaz nedir? Seçimler. Knights of the Old Republic, bu konuda tam anlamıyla bir ustalık dersi veriyor. İyi bir Jedi mı olacaksınız, yoksa karanlık tarafın çekimine kapılan bir Sith mi? Bu seçimler, sadece oyunun sonunu değil, aynı zamanda oynanışı ve karakterler arası dinamikleri de doğrudan etkiliyor. Jedi Düzeni’nin etik kurallarını sorgulatan diyaloglar mı istersiniz, yoksa bir kasabayı tamamen kaosa sürükleyen kötü bir Sith gibi davranmak mı? Her şey sizin elinizde.

Bir yandan klasik RPG mekaniklerini kullanırken, diğer yandan bunları Star Wars evrenine o kadar güzel yediriyor ki, oyun oynarken kendinizi gerçekten bir Jedi veya Sith gibi hissediyorsunuz. Güç yetenekleri, ışın kılıcı dövüşleri ve antik Jedi tapınaklarında yaptığınız keşifler, oyunu adeta bir Star Wars hayranının rüyası haline getiriyor.

[h2] Karakterler: Yoldaşların Gücü [/h2]

BioWare’in belki de en büyük başarısı, yan karakterleri yaratma konusundaki yeteneğidir. KOTOR bu konuda kesinlikle zirveye oynuyor. Bastila Shan, kibirli ama becerikli bir Jedi; HK-47, insanlara “çürük et torbaları” demekten hoşlanan sadist bir suikast droidi; ve Canderous Ordo, Mandalorian savaşçılarının gururlu temsilcisi. Bu karakterler sadece yol arkadaşlarınız değil; her biri kendi geçmişi, hedefleri ve çatışmaları olan yaşayan varlıklar gibi hissettiriyor.

Ve sonra, oyunun en büyük sürprizi geliyor: Darth Revan. Evet, hikâyeyi spoiler vermeden anlatmak zor, ama KOTOR’un o dönemde herkesin ağzını açık bırakan bir plot twist’i var ki, oyun tarihine adını altın harflerle yazdırıyor.

[h2] Teknik Taraflar: Dönemin Ötesinde [/h2]

Tamam, kabul edelim: 2003’te harika görünen grafikler, bugün biraz eski moda görünüyor. Ama Knights of the Old Republic, estetikten ziyade atmosfer yaratmadaki ustalığıyla parlıyor. Tatooine’nin sıcak kumlarından Dantooine’nin huzur veren çayırlarına, Korriban’ın karanlık mezarlarından Kashyyyk’in devasa ağaçlarına kadar her mekan, Star Wars evrenini mükemmel bir şekilde yansıtıyor.

Tabii ki oyun, dönemin RPG’lerinin bazı klasik sorunlarını taşıyor. Özellikle menü sistemi ve dövüş mekanikleri, bugün biraz hantal gelebilir. Ama bunlar, oyunun sunduğu genel deneyimin yanında ufak tefek ayrıntılar olarak kalıyor.

[h2] Sonuç: Jedi mı, Sith mi? [/h2]

Knights of the Old Republic, sadece bir oyun değil; aynı zamanda interaktif hikaye anlatıcılığının bir şaheseri. BioWare, oyuncuya inanılmaz bir özgürlük sunarken aynı zamanda güçlü bir hikaye deneyimi yaşatmayı başarmış. Star Wars hayranı olsanız da olmasanız da, bu oyun sizi içine çeken atmosferi ve unutulmaz karakterleriyle büyülüyor. 

Eğer bugüne kadar oynamadıysanız, şimdi tam zamanı. Ufak tefek grafik güncellemeleri ve modlarla, KOTOR’u 2025’te bile keyifle oynayabilirsiniz. Unutmayın: Güç sizinle olsun... ya da belki karanlık tarafı tercih edersiniz. Seçim sizin.

185813008.review:
genuinely an amazing game overall. if you can, go in blind. but i will say that the final boss is absolutely horrible. on my playthrough i somehow specced into a character that was completely useless against him. all the guides said to use stuff i did not have and could not go back and grind for because to load an earlier save would be to redo the entire dungeon leading up to him. which, might i add, throws like a gazillion enemies at you almost as if it was created just to drain your resources right before the final battle. i literally had to use cheats to beat him because it would have otherwise been impossible.

so some tips i guess. DO NOT get stasis field or force whirlwind or anything that either has a save or inflicts status effects. at least not until you get the other things i'm about to mention. they're good against every enemy EXCEPT the final boss. what you want for powers is at least one level of lightsaber throw, force immunity, heal, and force aura. for feats you need to max out flurry, don't even bother with the other attacks like critical or power strike. then max out both toughness and conditioning. finally, once you enter the final dungeon there's no going back. you'll know what it is when it's available for travel. [spoiler]it's a space station.[/spoiler] USE ALL YOUR CREDITS BEFOREHAND. you need a ton of life support kits and advanced med kits. adrenals too. also make sure you have a bunch of computer spikes because you need them to get armor in the final dungeon. you can't bring companions with you into the final two battles, but you should give them the same stuff.

overall i really enjoyed the game, i just wish the ending wasn't undercut by my character having literally no way to beat the final boss legit.

185809293.review: Old school RPG that does look dated, but still has classic star wars fun

185781617.review:
9.25/10
Beautiful, amazing game, one of the best RPGs of all time. It has some very well-developed characters with fascinating pasts and complex personalities and motivations, who you grow attached to throughout the game, and some very emotional moments, often resulting from your choices, which make KOTOR all the more impactful. The story is incredibly well-written, and feels just like a Star Wars film. (Spoiler, not for a plot point, but for a storytelling device that is used in this game): [spoiler] it has arguably the greatest plot twist in video game history and one of the greatest plot twists in history, period [/spoiler]. Furthermore, you feel in control of your character, who you can build up and control, making meaningful choices throughout the game. This is Star Wars at its peak, RPGs at their peak, and BioWare at its peak. KOTOR is easily the best Star Wars game ever, minus its sequel KOTOR 2.
These aren't negatives, but the graphics are outdated (but still hold up imo), the story is linear with player choices, and the combat is turn-based with pause (but it's different from most turn-based combat, it looks real-time).

185776777.review:
Я никогда не пойму культовости KOTOR. Во-первых игра сама по себе багованная, не адаптированная под современные системы, постоянно багующаяся, вылетающая, она не имеет встроенного изначально русского языка, поддержки широкоформата и далее, далее... После танцев с бубном, сотни переустановок и чистки файлов я наконец смог запустить с натяжкой стабильно работающую версию игры, которая играется... посредственно.
Баланс боёв странный, глупый и такое ощущение что есть только на первых двух локациях. После спуска в подземелье сохраняешься перед каждым боем, потому что шанс того что пати отъедет от пачки гориллычей почти максимальный. Постоянно необходимо тратить драгоценные расходники, члены отряда не имеют полного здоровья до конца агрессивной локации а врагов-то только больше. На Дантуине, в академии, миссию с соло-зачисткой собак я вообще не понял. Сам бой заключается в постоянной микрёжке не самых одарённых интеллектом юнитов, которые вечно бегают, втыкают, делают что угодно но ТОЛЬКО СУКА НЕ ВОЮЮТ! Анимации ближнего боя неплохие, на них можно было бы позалипать, если бы в игре был смысл от кнопки обычной атаки. Вообще дико раздражает ещё и то, что персонажи тупо не могут попасть друг по другу. В упор блять промахиваться из пулемёта - достойно уважения. Особенно глупо это выглядит в кат-сценах. Бои из-за кривых героев превращаются в симулятор надписи "промах". Это типа отсылка на штурмовиков из оригинальной трилогии?
Ролевая составляющая игры тоже не может порадовать чем-то интересным. Вариантов развития диалога как правило два: вариант для развития сюжета и вариант для пубертатной девочки. Первый приводит к адекватному диалогу с НПС и раскрывает сюжет, а второй выглядит как "Ааа я конченый ааа! Тупая мразь гони бабло или я тебя щас захуярю блять!". Это не отыгрыш злого персонажа, это позоризще.
Ну и в конце концов общая атмосфера. Она... где? Персонажи в кат-сценах говорят какими-то клишированными, дибильными речами, как будто бы игра сделана для 0+ аудитории а сюжет писал Микки-Маус, хотя до продажи франшизы Диснею ещё вообще-то далеко. Иногда такой кринж ловил, вы бы знали. Поведение персонажей (включая основных), квесты и локации - всё выводит из атмосферы ЗВ и переносит тебя в стереотипную РПГ про избранного с квестами в духе "Убей, найди, подай". Из приятного лишь мини-игры. Благодаря KOTOR узнал про Пазаак и сделал собственную колоду, вышло прикольно. 
Как итог - посредственность. Игра не то что плохо сохранилась, она как будто бы изначально была не лучшим вариантом, а возвели её в статус культовой только потому, что альтернативы среди игр по франшизе особо-то и нет. И не надо мне с пеной у рта доказывать, что я что-то не выкупил, до куда-то не доиграл или не поставил тот самый мод. Если какой-то из этих пунктов всё-таки верен, то это значит, что игра действительно хреновая, раз она что-то не объясняет или откладывает что-то на потом, не завлекает игрока с ходу. KOTOR, как по мне, ещё одно доказательство того, что даже не смотря на то, что по ЗВ много игр, хороших игр по франшизе очень мало.

185741706.review: fun game, brings back a lot of nostalgia

185739124.review:
[h3]Did you ever hear the tragedy of BioWare studios? I thought not. It's not a story EA would tell you...[/h3]

This is the game that was a path to BioWare glory and actual damnation. Why? Because this game was the start of their famous formula that they would use for nearly 2 decades afterwards. Be it Dragon Age or Mass Effect series. With the exception of Dragon Age II, of course. Always defeat big bad baddies, but not before we visit three or four locations to find some gimmicks in order to sway the course of war in our own way. Concluding in an epic battle all to remember. Reminds you of something? Yeah. But there is a big difference. You actually have CHOICE. To finish those tasks, however you please. Without pleasing anyone in the process! Yes, you can be a complete dick to anyone during the game! Not babysitting you, Carth! Not this time! Well, okay. Until the end, so you won't escape from my judgment...

It's actually hilarious that new BioWare games are not indistinguishable from old ones on a surface level. Until you delve deeper and see how much they differ. How much they've been stripped of all that made them exceptional in the first place. Writing, immersion, choice. Even your character's personal agenda! Imagine that! It's a great tragedy that this game is so unplayable on new versions. So people could actually experience this gem for what it is.

[u]And if you want to experience it, just turn off soft shadows and frame buffer effects in order to prevent the game from crashing.[/u]

[spoiler]Didn't know that I'd be in the exact predicament as Mission did when Veilguard was released. But oh well. Someone decided to turn on a dark side this time. Or was it all along?[/spoiler]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BCuaPIonLT8

185407680.review:
This is an old game now, and inevitably cannot be expected to be optimized for modern operating systems. 

For me, this results in regular 'freezes' of the character being stuck in place, especially after combat. This can be worked around by saving, quitting to the menu screen, and reloading. However, this becomes a chore. A shame, as the game itself is a hell of a lot of fun, with its customization, compelling storyline, and humor. 

Worth picking up for nostalgia, but cannot recommend to everyone on account of its frequent freezes.

185227637.review:
Surprisingly good game. It runs on Star Wars D20 (D&D Clone) logic in the background meaning most everything is a dice roll even if not visible, it's very fun to play but you just need to be aware that whenever you aren't directly controlling a party member they're doing one of three things:
1: Getting in melee range during when they are using a ranged weapon
2: Nothing
3: Running off to god knows where
Melee characters also love to run over landmines when you aren't controlling them.
It's a very similar experience to herding cats. It's a great game though, most of my hours in this game were on the original Xbox version as a kid.

My only wish for the game would be for it to be an FPS/RPG game like Fallout because the experience of missing point blank is similar to having your testicles in a vice. Still a great game though. I pawned off a lightsaber

185223955.review: This is the best Star Wars game ever made and my favorite game of all time. 10/10

185181954.review: Some may disagree here, but I actually like kotor over kotor 2. Just a little. I think a lot of it has to do with becoming a Jedi for the first time, the environments, and the characters. The story is also very good. It's a bit touchy on newer systems, especially getting it to run in high RES and all that, but with some mods and tweaking, it runs great. 10/10 all day! Classic.

185164027.review:
Knights of the Old Republic is easily *the* best Star Wars RPG in existence. It was genuinely the first game that ever made me think games could actually be art. That was just because it felt like a playable Star Wars movie and I have since learned to think deeper, but that does not make Knights of the Old Republic any less great.

With that said, it is also a *dinosaur* of a game. It runs but that's about all you can say it has going for it. You can thankfully get it up and running without too much fuss and it does run well enough after that. It's just something to be aware of.

Additionally, you will also want to know that the combat is this weird psuedo real-time system where actions are performed in combat rounds like a turn-based system but you can move and queue up actions in real-time. I must admit the result is an experience that's rather clunky. Bioware went on to use something similar for Dragon Age: Origins but make no mistake, this system can only manage to be half as smooth as that already rather clunky system.

Once you get past those two matters or maybe you're just an eccentric who really likes real-time turn-based hybrid combat systems and/or maybe is okay playing a game in 800x600 in 2025, you are in for one hell of a time with this game.

185160940.review: After waiting 21.5 years and saving this game for a rainy day, that rainy day has come. And it was well worth the wait... This game has single handedly restored my love for SW and is better than anything that has come out for nearly 20 years.

185134296.review:
[h1] A Timeless Classic for Star Wars Fans and RPG Lovers[/h1]

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic is a masterpiece that transcends time. Set 4,000 years before the rise of the Galactic Empire, it offers a rich and immersive story that lets you carve your path as a Jedi or fall to the dark side. The characters are unforgettable, from the witty HK-47 to the stoic Bastila Shan, and the twists in the narrative will leave you speechless.

The gameplay combines traditional RPG mechanics (based on the Third Edition of Dungeon & Dragons) with tactical combat, and while the graphics show their age they still have a charm and style that remains gorgeous to this day. The world-building and storytelling remain top-tier. Whether you're exploring Taris, battling Sith Lords, or uncovering ancient secrets, the sense of adventure is unparalleled.

If you love deep narratives, moral choices, and the Star Wars universe, this is a must-play. May the Force be with you!

185123908.review:
I adore this game, BUT if you want to play it do NOT get the steam version (unless you know how to mod the game) because after you finish combat, you cannot walk around unless you click on interactable objects. This means the tutorial area will have you stuck in a room forever because the walking simply won't turn on again.
Get this game on GoG, not Steam. the Goglins will treat you fairer in their territory than Gaben's mass of evil and hate.

184171214.review:
Pros:
+Great story
+Memorable characters
+Great tactical approach to combat
+Top notch voice-acting
+A major twist that will shock newcomers
+Beautiful orchestrated score with authentic Star Wars feel
+Unique environments
+Hours of content and variety
+Ability to choose if you want to be "good/light" or "evil/dark"
+Game runs smoothly on modern PC's

Cons:
-Graphics haven't aged as well as they should
-Not a lot of aesthetic variety in some gear.
-Some missions/quests make you feel like a chore
-Some enemies and/or bosses have a higher difficulty than they should
-Some story missions require trial and error

Bug(s)/Glitches encountered: The only one I have encountered is that sometimes when exiting a cutscene, I couldn't move my character except when clicking on an object or interacting with another NPC. Fixed by loading from previous save.

Other issues: Game seems to "crash" or window seems to minimize even when you have other programs turned off. Others report graphical issues, although I haven't run into any of them.

Final thoughts: This game is a classic and I loved it back when it first came out. Been playing it for years and will continue to play it for many years to come. Everything you love about Star Wars is right here in this game. Is it perfect? No. But is it a great game? Yes! If you love Star Wars and RPG's, this is the game for you.

183965884.review: While this classic is near and dear to my gaming heart and from a time when Bioware was a studio with passion and love for the craft, it is also showing its age at this point. A fan patch for widescreen is needed, and you will want to add HD and quality-of-life mods as well. The story and plot are decent, but the combat and mini-games are a drag. Unless you are an old Star Wars fan or have a thing for playing old games from a bygone age, I can't recommend it. But if none of this bothers you, get it on sale and take a trip back in time.

183784682.review:
Легендарна класика Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic – гра, яку неможливо забути

Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic – це справжній витвір мистецтва у світі RPG і один із найкращих проєктів у всесвіті Зоряних війн. Попри свій поважний вік, вона й досі вражає і заслуговує на увагу навіть у сучасному світі геймінгу.

Сюжет – це серце і душа цієї гри. Він захопливий, із безліччю несподіваних поворотів, глибокими персонажами і вибором дій, які по-справжньому впливають на розвиток історії. Ти буквально проживаєш своє життя в цьому всесвіті: відчуваєш силу світлої чи темної сторони, ухвалюєш складні рішення та досліджуєш величезний, насичений світ.

Ігровий процес теж заслуговує похвали. Бойова система, прокачка персонажів і діалогова система – усе це настільки продумано і зручно, що навіть через роки грати комфортно й цікаво.

Щодо графіки – так, вона не найкраща за сучасними стандартами, але для свого часу була чудовою. До того ж, атмосфера і стиль гри повністю компенсують її технічну «старовину». І навіть тепер, через стільки років, ти швидко забуваєш про візуальні недоліки, коли занурюєшся в цей фантастичний світ.

Я обожнюю цю гру і раджу її всім: як фанатам Зоряних війн, так і любителям якісних RPG. Це досвід, який ти не забудеш, і гра, до якої хочеться повертатися знову і знову.

183750453.review:

Ive gotten stuck on the starting menus, setting up characters, and just freezing in the first time you move. I cannot get this to run. You cant make it look good via resolution settings to fit your screen. Not to mention there are no real Graphics/Display options. You also cannot alt+tab at all, it just stutters everything. 
This is one of the worst ports or copy/pastes Ive ever seen..... and its THIS game. 

Shame on you.

183711868.review: 101/10 would follow the revanchist into war against the mandalorians

183697252.review:
[h2] Одна из лучших и любимых сюжетных игр про Звездные Войны и первых RPG, которая заложила фундамент золотого времени для BioWare. [/h2]

Очень понравилась история главного героя и Бастилы, спустя время появляется желание пройти игру заново под другим билдом персонажа. Сам сюжет в духе кино от Лукаса, где ситхи доминируют в галактике, главные герои и джедаи пытаются их остановить. Отдельно хорошо проработаны истории персонажей, квесты, диалоги, прокачка своего персонажа, понравились некоторые локации, планеты, эмбиенты в духе ЗВ, но здесь он немного особый, а не просто взятый из фильмов. Вот просто приятно бегать со своим отрядом по локациям, собирать предметы, прокачивать персонажа за светлого или темного джедая, принимать решения в диалогах и следовать сюжету. Есть желание пройти побочные задания, нету тех, вещей, которые держат игрока на одном месте, т.к. локации на планетах небольшие.

Самый главный недостаток - это уже устаревшая боевая система в виде пошагового броска кубика. Понятно, что в те времена она была еще неплохой, но сейчас порог вхождения резко снизился и может отпугнуть и наскучить многим игрокам. Иногда требуется дожидаться удачного броска кубика, хитрить и загружать save заново. Никто не застрахован от багов и вылетов спустя некоторое время игры от таких старых игр. Но, все равно, игра оставляет хорошие впечатления из детства.

Игру рекомендую, однозначно, хотя бы раз пройти. Далее потом или сразу рассмотреть глобальный мод пак, восстановленный контент и так далее. Надеюсь, что когда нибудь мир увидит качественный Remake.

183614207.review: Clunky gameplay nowadays but at its essence this is a classic Star Wars story, with great role play opportunity and potential for multiple runs making different choices. Have played this game maybe 20 odd times and its always fun! An absolute must for any Star Wars fan who is able to look past the outdated graphics and gameplay and instead focus on the story and lore this game adds to the Star Wars EU.

183600544.review:
Une véritable révolution dans le monde du jeu vidéo. 
On a tant aimé cette licence mais encore plus à travers ces opus, merci de nous avoir offert des jeux aussi qualitatifs pour l'époque. 
Fortement recommandé en complément du 2. Un grand bravo !

183586952.review: Hard to recommend with this version of the game. I don't mind tinkering with an older game to get it to work, but it requires a modding guide to get it running in widescreen and working to an acceptable level. With steam's KOTOR II version getting patched with controller, workshop, achievement support, it's a shame the first game has been left in this state. I would recommend playing this game 100% as it is a really fun Star Wars adventure, but unless they patch it, I would pick it up on one of the modern console ports.

183585223.review: Still a good game to play on the go on the Steam Deck.  I like the story better than any Disney Star Wars movies.

183539532.review: Always liked this game, played it when it first came out. One problem this steam version had was it was unstable and kept crashing over and over. I tried all kinds of "fixes", I found online , to no avail, until one day I ended up in graphics settings, instead of trying to change resolution....AGAIN, I accidentally shut off the "grass" setting, viola!, no weird visual artifacts on Dantooine, and it became playable, Very Happy. Merry Christmas!!!

183511509.review: Le meilleur jeu Star Wars ! Rpg Bioware par excellence.
